[DQC.US.0135.9835] The element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanAmortizationOfGainsLosses has been used in the filing but does not appear in the financial statements of the filing. This disclosure should appear in the face financials unless it is included in another account caption. If this is the case the following element(s) us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditAmortizationOfGainLossStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList,DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList should be used to identify the account where the financial statement element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanAmortizationOfGainsLosses is included. In the case of pension elements the element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList can be used as a catch all for those cases where a company indicates that all pension costs are included in a specific line item on the financial statements.
If the filing does not disclose the financial statement captions where the amounts appear, an extension element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditAmortizationOfGainLossStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleListNotDisclosedFlag can be used. If this element is used, the rule will not produce an error.
The following is an example of a fact that does not have an extensible list.
Concept : us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanAmortizationOfGainsLosses Value : -1,968,000 Period : 2021-01-04 to 2022-01-02 Dimensions : us-gaap:RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis=us-gaap:ForeignPlanMember Unit : USD Decimals: -3
Rule Element Id:9835 Rule version: 20.0.0RC1 - http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/715787/000071578722000005/tile-20220102.htm 4

property.name: label
property.value: Defined Benefit Plan, Amortization of Gain (Loss)

entry.message:
[DQC.US.0135.9835] The element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanRecognizedNetGainLossDueToCurtailments has been used in the filing but does not appear in the financial statements of the filing. This disclosure should appear in the face financials unless it is included in another account caption. If this is the case the following element(s) DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList,us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditCurtailmentGainLossStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList should be used to identify the account where the financial statement element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanRecognizedNetGainLossDueToCurtailments is included. In the case of pension elements the element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList can be used as a catch all for those cases where a company indicates that all pension costs are included in a specific line item on the financial statements.
If the filing does not disclose the financial statement captions where the amounts appear, an extension element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditCurtailmentGainLossStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleListNotDisclosedFlag can be used. If this element is used, the rule will not produce an error.
The following is an example of a fact that does not have an extensible list.
Concept : us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanRecognizedNetGainLossDueToCurtailments Value : 453,000 Period : 2018-12-31 to 2019-12-29 Dimensions : us-gaap:RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis=us-gaap:ForeignPlanMember Unit : USD Decimals: -3
Rule Element Id:9835 Rule version: 20.0.0RC1 - http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/715787/000071578722000005/tile-20220102.htm 4

property.name: label
property.value: Defined Benefit Plan, Net Periodic Benefit Cost (Credit), Gain (Loss) Due to Curtailment

entry.message:
[DQC.US.0135.9835] The element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanInterestCost has been used in the filing but does not appear in the financial statements of the filing. This disclosure should appear in the face financials unless it is included in another account caption. If this is the case the following element(s) us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditInterestCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList,DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList should be used to identify the account where the financial statement element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanInterestCost is included. In the case of pension elements the element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList can be used as a catch all for those cases where a company indicates that all pension costs are included in a specific line item on the financial statements.
If the filing does not disclose the financial statement captions where the amounts appear, an extension element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditInterestCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleListNotDisclosedFlag can be used. If this element is used, the rule will not produce an error.
The following is an example of a fact that does not have an extensible list.
Concept : us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanInterestCost Value : 5,676,000 Period : 2018-12-31 to 2019-12-29 Dimensions : us-gaap:RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis=us-gaap:ForeignPlanMember Unit : USD Decimals: -3
Rule Element Id:9835 Rule version: 20.0.0RC1 - http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/715787/000071578722000005/tile-20220102.htm 4

[DQC.US.0135.9835] The element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanExpectedReturnOnPlanAssets has been used in the filing but does not appear in the financial statements of the filing. This disclosure should appear in the face financials unless it is included in another account caption. If this is the case the following element(s) DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList,us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExpectedReturnLossStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList should be used to identify the account where the financial statement element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanExpectedReturnOnPlanAssets is included. In the case of pension elements the element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList can be used as a catch all for those cases where a company indicates that all pension costs are included in a specific line item on the financial statements.
If the filing does not disclose the financial statement captions where the amounts appear, an extension element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExpectedReturnLossStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleListNotDisclosedFlag can be used. If this element is used, the rule will not produce an error.
The following is an example of a fact that does not have an extensible list.
Concept : us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanExpectedReturnOnPlanAssets Value : 5,561,000 Period : 2018-12-31 to 2019-12-29 Dimensions : us-gaap:RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis=us-gaap:ForeignPlanMember Unit : USD Decimals: -3
Rule Element Id:9835 Rule version: 20.0.0RC1 - http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/715787/000071578722000005/tile-20220102.htm 4

property.name: label
property.value: Defined Benefit Plan, Expected Return (Loss) on Plan Assets

entry.message:
[DQC.US.0135.9835] The element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanAmortizationOfPriorServiceCostCredit has been used in the filing but does not appear in the financial statements of the filing. This disclosure should appear in the face financials unless it is included in another account caption. If this is the case the following element(s) us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditAmortizationOfPriorServiceCostCreditStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList,DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList should be used to identify the account where the financial statement element us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanAmortizationOfPriorServiceCostCredit is included. In the case of pension elements the element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditExcludingServiceCostStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleList can be used as a catch all for those cases where a company indicates that all pension costs are included in a specific line item on the financial statements.
If the filing does not disclose the financial statement captions where the amounts appear, an extension element DefinedBenefitPlanNetPeriodicBenefitCostCreditAmortizationOfPriorServiceCostCreditStatementOfIncomeOrComprehensiveIncomeExtensibleListNotDisclosedFlag can be used. If this element is used, the rule will not produce an error.
The following is an example of a fact that does not have an extensible list.
